column4: Cisco to buy OpenDNS for $635 million to boost security business
column5: Cisco Systems Inc  said on Tuesday it would buy OpenDNS  a privately held cloud-based security firm  for $635 million  the latest move to boost its security business as cyber attacks increase in number and sophistication.

column4: Capital controls mean Greeks can click  but not buy
column5: LONDON Monday was the day the music died for thousands of song downloaders and music streamers in Greece.

column4: UPDATE 1-Capital controls mean Greeks can click  but not buy
column5: * Many online suppliers handle payment from single European centre

column4: Capital controls mean Greeks can click  but not buy
column5: * Many online suppliers handle payment from single European centre

column4: Microsoft hands display ads to AOL  maps to Uber
column5: SEATTLE Microsoft Corp  said on Monday it will hand over its display advertising business to AOL Inc and sell some map-generating technology to ride-hailing app company Uber  as it slims down its money-losing online operations.

column4: Qualcomm has no plans to spin off chip business at present: chairman
column5: SEOUL U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc has no plans to spin off its chips business at present  Executive Chairman Paul Jacobs said on Tuesday  despite recent investor pressure to do so amid intensifying industry competition.

column4: Cisco to buy OpenDNS for $635 mln to boost security business
column5: June 30 Cisco Systems Inc said on Tuesday it would buy OpenDNS  a privately held cloud-based security company  for $635 million in cash and equity awards.
